metadata.name: Potentially Over Permissive Permissions Granted Using Dsacls.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects usage of Dsacls to grant over permissive permissions

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\dsacls.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('dsacls.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /g ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('gr')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ge')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('gw')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ga')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('wp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('wd'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of Dsacls to grant over permissive permissions

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrators granting over permissive permissions to users References: https://ss64.com/nt/dsacls.html, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2012-r2-and-2012/cc771151(v=ws.11)
